Select the project root as the container for the new file.
Select an EPackage as the object to create.

I can't reproduce this.  You couldn't get an exception like this unless there
was an EDataType reference in the file.

"Point" is a class that I created in another model but I had already renamed it 
to "EPoint", so "Point" didn't exist anymore.  That particular model I reload 
from Java Interfaces, not from an ".ecore" file.

So it sounds like some kind of leak somewhere, because I don't have any 
editors/models opened when I reproduce this problem.

You don't describe any steps that I could follow to reproduce a problem.  In any
event, it's definitely possible to reference a file that has been modified and
that the reference will fail to resolve.  There's no way to avoid that in general...

traces.message: The  object 'org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EDataTypeImpl@3f21d6 (name: Point)  (instanceClassName: Point) (serializable: true)' is not contained in a resource.
